    star_border edit

    David, by default, an image is rendered inline, like a letter so it sits on the same line that a, b, c and d sit on. There is space below that line for the descenders you find on letters like g, j, p and q.


    You can:


    • adjust the vertical-align of the image to position it elsewhere (e.g. the middle ) or

    • change the display so it isn’t inline.
